This park is in named for and in dedication to James Peter (Pete) Lindsay.  Situated there is a centrally located placard placed in memoriam to him.  According to the placard, Pete Lindsay played an integral part in the development of DTC as a board member of the Goldsmith Metropolitan District.  His work was instrumental, affecting not just DTC's building architecture, but also its landscape and extensive parks.  

I won't lie, this location is somewhat hidden/obscured by all the buildings around it and is close to the intersection of a couple main veins in DTC.  It is very small in size and not clearly defined.  If I hadn't seen the dedication, I would have just as easily thought of this as "the landscaping area between two buildings".  I found this place by accident or at least by happenstance. 

However, I felt it absolutely necessary to add this location to Google Maps.  DTC is a staple of prosperity, growth, and architectural aesthetics in the greater Denver Metro area.  This small park deserves to be noticed; it is part of a greater, grander system of parks and landscaping that defines the beauty of the area.  

Here on a summer day I imagine it would be nice to gaze at the sky at sunset, as hues of gold wash over the clouds and reflect off the surrounding buildings.  A happy accident.  Thank you, Mr. Lindsay.

name: Tavern Tech Center
address: 5336 DTC Blvd, Greenwood Village, CO 80111, USA
reviews:
We super liked this place when Shannon was working there.  Great food and service was spectacular. 
We went there after she left and the bartender was great.  The food was also the same. 
My only complaint would be to monitor the DJ on Thursday night.  Her music choices should be left on the playground.   We are adults with grown up taste.   It would be better not to play anything.
But for everything else,  good job!
Thank you
Great happy hour specials and food was wonderful. I had the blt club on a croissant and my friend had the volcano burger! Fast friendly service, ask for Jay....he's the best waiter!

Food and drinks were really good. Waiter was helpful and friendly but forgot to enter order for our appetizer. Ambience was nice. Restaurant was clean and all staff we encountered were very welcoming and friendly. Would definitely return there again.

Did the Bloody Mary bar for brunch and it was fantastic.  A great selection to assemble your drink.  The food was hardy and was great on a Saturday morning.  We arrived shortly after open and the service was extremely quick.  Even after about an hour and a half there it wasn't too busy and service was quick.
Stopped by for a whiskey sour, bacon cheddar burger, and some hockey. Left after enjoying all three and didn't put a huge dent in my wallet. Will visit again.

name: Burnt End BBQ in Denver
address: 5332 DTC Blvd #100, Greenwood Village, CO 80111, USA
reviews: Have been eating here for years, and they have never disappointed. The food has always been delicious and the staff is always friendly. The bronco platter is hands down the best BBQ deal in town. Thanks Burnt End for the great food!

Came in for restaurant week, great service, very friendly, we had 2,2 meat plates (brisket, Turkey, pulled pork and sausage) all the meats were tasty as were most of the sides.   The Mac was disappointing, but the beans, corn bread and wedges were awesome.   Also have a pretty good beer selection on draught.   Reason for 4 stars, our food was Luke warm at best and they were out of fries, brownies, burnt ends and wings.  Would surely return, just hope food will be hot.   They offer military discount!✌🏽

One of my favorite BBQ places in the Denver area. The staff are friendly, efficient, and great to interact with. The place is kept clean. The food is great and priced reasonably. I totally recommend trying the brisket and the burnt ends. Overall I fully recommend giving them a try!

Awesome (huge)  smoked wings.  First time eating here and loved it. I wish that the Carolina style sauce wasn't so spicy but otherwise amazing!  Boyfriend got the dtc bowl. He must have loved it too cause he ate every single bite.

I have eaten here a few dozen times now, and I have to say their burnt ends are good, and the sauces are good, but the rest is lacking. the brisket thr last few times has been overcooked, dry, and bland.

name: ASA Sushi
address: 5302 DTC Blvd #100, Greenwood Village, CO 80111, USA
reviews: Complete surprise for anyone who loves Sushi. My wife and I had the best service and food here on Valentines day. The sushi was the freshest we ever had. The Hawaiian role was the best one by far to experience. We're incredibly grateful for the experience and cannot wait to go here again with friends.

This place is YUMMY! My husband works nearby, so I meet him for lunch sometimes and this is my favorite place to go. They have wonderful sashimi and I love their cucumber salad. I’m obsessed with their fatty tuna, I could have that everyday for the rest of my life and be happy. It’s seriously the best. The service is always wonderful, the restaurant is clean and quiet. So unexpected for such a busy strip center. I just love this place!

$17.00 for 2 tiny little, literally 3 cm pieces of beef in a mountain of fried noodles. Literally. Like there isn’t any meat on the dish. Why are you people rating this place 5 stars? Biggest ripoff I’ve ever seen in any restaurant in this entire city, hands-down.
I pick up lunch for my boss often and it is always fresh and ready when I arrive. I don't know the girl's name behind the counter, but she is always super sweet.

Great vegetarian options! Enjoyed so much the Angry Edamame and seaweed salad appetizers with the all vegetable roll, and veggie caterpillar roll!!!! Very fresh, delicious, and great service! Also, my friend has a gluten allergy and they were attentive to accommodate her needs! Check them out! :)

name: Hoffman Park
address: 5302 S Boston St, Greenwood Village, CO 80111, USA
reviews: Very nice and quite park, my almost 2 year old had fun running around.
Hideaway park small and quiet
I enjoyed my walk here Friday, its just beautiful
Great small park with lots of big awesome shady trees. Excellent for an afternoon picnic with the family away from crowds. Decent playground equipment for toddlers and even sand to dig in!
I'm sure this space was great at one time

name: Francis H. Williams Park
address: 5730 S Florence Ct, Greenwood Village, CO 80111, USA
reviews: Jeremy and David cleaning windows for our personal company DJ Windows!!!!It was fantastic customers were welcoming and enjoyable to work for.
Walking my dog here, great place for kids!
Quiet clean and relaxing

name: Bear Park
address: 5361 S Havana Ct, Englewood, CO 80111, USA
reviews: REALLY clean park, a quiet neighborhood, with lots of stuff for the kids to play on, as well as a large open grassy area, complete w tree carved into a BEAR!!! PRETTY COOL!
This place would be a great place for children of all ages... But, there is profanity and vulgar depictions scribbled all over the playsets.

its a really nice place although seems like a spooky abandoned place ahahaha. there's a playground for kids on the other side of the bridge over the creek. saw a few people fishing at the creek only enhanced the beautiful view. cars aren't allowed inside the park although there's a parking place at a corner by the entrance
Park is always clean and well maintained... I only wish that the tennis courts are public and dont need a key.
Nice place. Good for kids

name: Jason's Deli
address: 5440 S Parker Rd, Aurora, CO 80015, USA
reviews: The staff was very friendly and informative of their system and menu. The manager refused my tip and insisted I give it to a fellow employee of his instead of himself. Major act of humility! Salad bar was delicious and the customer service was stellar.

I haven't had Jason's in 5 years since I moved to an area that doesn't have one but was pleasantly surprised to find myself just down the street from here while working in the area. It didn't disappoint! One of the only chain places I look forward to visiting! Friendly faces and delicious food! 😋

I had a great customer service experience here today! I ordered food online and paid in advance. Then I got super busy at work and couldn’t run out to pick up my food until TWO hours later. I fully expected to just pick up my food and warm it back up in my office. Instead, my food wasn’t sitting there waiting for me and all of the employees knew who I was, and anticipated remaking my food whenever I did come in. They made my food fresh for me, assured me they didn’t want me to eat my cold, two hour old food. It was so nice!
Great food and free ice cream!   It's a great place to grab a bite to eat and they have a diverse menu to choose from as well as a full salad bar and soups!

Great selection of food. Large salad bar, huge sandwich menu, wide variety of soup, nice atmosphere and friendly service. And free self serve soft ice cream cones for dessert. Nice touch. Highly recommend.

name: Sabor
address: 5350 S Parker Rd, Aurora, CO 80015, USA
reviews: If you want some Mexican fast food this is good place for it just remember is fast food. the food is not very flavorful and place can be cleaner. Also they yelled the items in the order instead of the customer's name so you might get confused with someone else's order. Price is good.

We wanted to try this place out since it has good reviews and it is close to home. We went through the drive thru and had to wait a bit even though the restaurant wasn't busy at all. The staff was friendly and apologetic about the wait but when we got home the food was lukewarm at best. Even the green Chile on the burritos was cold. Maybe we should have gone in but we literally live two minutes away so even if the food was hot to begin with it shouldn't have gotten cold so quickly so the food must not have been warm to begin with.

Great food and service. I loved their tacos and the fact that they have lots of options while ordering a plate of food. I liked the black beans option. They also had a bucket load of different types of salsa.
Food here is unfortunately just not good. Sub par service. Wanted to love it because I live so close but wont be back.

Wow!! I feel like I got special treatment. 
Everything on point!... portions, price, flavor, service.
The only way I was able to bend the laws of physics and get the whole thing inside me was because the Sabor, I mean flavor kept me going till it was all gone!

name: Thirsty 30 Craft Kitchen & Tap House
address: 5428 S Parker Rd, Aurora, CO 80015, USA
reviews: We were half an hour too early for brunch and didn't realize it because the doors were unlocked but the people were super cool and seated us anyway. The french toast was really good, loved the bacon and I usually don't like breakfast potatoes but boy, were they seasoned great. All of it was super tasty. The bar looked like it had around 30 beers on tap. Guess we'll have to go back for happy hour!
This place burgers are one of the best here in Co/ Parker, they pretty much make everything from scratch from the buns to the pickles. Last hour not least there prices pretty good as well!! #mggritz

I enjoyed the beverage selection and rotational taps, my wife and I were also given 2 free drinks while the bartender was making up new creations which was cool to be samplers. It is veteran owned and veterans get discounts which is always a positive. Food was great and came out hot and fresh. 

The seats were not filled however and could be due to location and advertising. But it is a great stop for a quick bite and drink or to enjoy evening trivia.

We are trying to support local restaurants during the "shutdown," and decided to finally try Thirsty 30 after telling ourselves we needed to for some time. Placed a phone order and the food was ready when we arrived to pick it up about 20 minutes later. Everything was terrific: Barbacoa Burger, Loaded Tots, Apple Harvest Salad. The burgers were sided with roasted Brussels sprouts! The sprouts will make believers out of anyone. Will definitely eat there once this stuff is over.
Great wings and lots of fun playing bingo!

name: Shipley's Donuts
address: 5400 S Parker Rd, Aurora, CO 80015, USA
reviews: I feel like I am in a relationship with these donuts. We have a group text about them. We share photos of them. My husband makes plans around them. I preplan the flavor to order. Life is good with Shipley's.

Decided to try Shipleys on an early Sunday morning. I love donuts and they did not disappoint!! So delightful and fresh! We enjoyed all of the ones we tried!! Large dining area inside, but we got them to go. We tried the sausage, cheese and jalapeño kolouches (I’m probably spelling that wrong) but pretty much a breakfast roll with different fillings. We also tried the ham and cheese. Simple and delightful. We’ll definitely be back! Also, great customer service!!

I never leave a review, but my level of disappointment has never been so high. First time to this place, went through the drive thru and ordered a half-dozen iced cake donuts and two filled bars and a cappuccino. I specifically asked for chocolate frosting and sprinkles for the cake donuts. When I got home to see, only one of the cake donuts of the half dozen was frosted and it was nothing like the order I wanted. The employees did not mention that they were substituting the donuts in any way. I feel that I wasted my money and will not be going here again.

Love the kalaches and the donuts are great. Coffee is pretty good as well. Employees and the owner are very friendly and up beat. Great place to meet up with a few friends to sit and chat. Would be a good place to get donuts for any office get together or meetings.. Much better than that dunkin place for sure.

I came in and ordered seven dozen at the counter and prepaid for an additional 10 later in the week. Although there was a little bit of shock at the time of order they gladly boxed and prepared everything in a timely manner. Clients prefer these over other brands and the area. Definitely recommend

name: Jabanero's Mexican Grill
address: 5584 S Parker Rd, Aurora, CO 80015, USA
reviews: I’ve been coming here since the day they opened with no complaints. They are the only place I’ve been able to find good spicy green chili and a great burrito. The owner and her family are amazing I 200% recommended this place.

First time visiting but I was very impressed with this place. Friendly, clean, comfortable. I ordered a breakfast burrito smothered and was delicious!! Watch out for the hot. They finish the burrito on a panini press which puts it over the top. I will be back!

I've driven by this place a million times.  Finally went in for breakfast burritos this morning and they were pretty good!  Comparable burritos at other places cost double the price.  It was an inexpensive, filling, tasty breakfast.

This place is amazing the owner always says hi to my kids,my husband and I, 
Most Mexican food in Colorado isn't very good but I love the food it's the best I've had in a restaurant here in Colorado.

The food is pretty good. Not huge portions but very filling. The green chili is very good. The only downside is that the restaurant is on the small side. It can make you feel rushed to eat when you see a line forming at the door without any seats available.

name: Indian Ridge Samsung Galaxy Project
address: 16501 E Progress Dr, Centennial, CO 80015, USA

name: Crestline Park
address: Centennial, CO 80015, USA
reviews: Beautiful park. Nice path and playground. Easy to access. Paths do get very icy in the winter.
Beautiful community park. The kids love the play area and open field. Also, a great place to walk the pups and if you can go towards early evening you can smell the foliage.
Quiet place to take a walk or sit and read. Also a large field and basketball courts for activities.0
A pokestop and a gym here very nice 👌
The new playground is really fun. My kids love to play while I run laps in the park.

name: Arapahoe County Open Space Grant Supported Project
address: 17230 E Progress Ave, Centennial, CO 80015, USA
reviews: Pretty as ever

name: Smoky Hill Park
address: Centennial, CO 80015, USA

name: Goldrush Park
address: Centennial, CO 80015, USA

name: Big Sandy Park
address: 17903 E Progress Pl, Centennial, CO 80015, USA
reviews: Its small but great place to bring the kiddos.
Nice little space close to home to get outside with the kids. Basic gravel playground with see-saw and swings. Lots of open grassy area to kick a ball around.

Small park with a nice field and a bike path. Backing up to smoky hill, the traffic is sort of loud. The park has a pokestop and gym if anyone cares anymore, but it's pretty small, as far as the playground goes. Nice place for little kids. There is no parking, but you can park in the street behind the park. Not much entertainment, but it's not usually busy and it's got a book box. I'd recommend it to people with kids around 5 years old.
Good place to walk.
Dog friendly, large open fiels and a nice playground for youngins

name: Arrowhead Park
address: Centennial, CO 80015, USA

name: Sonic Drive-In
address: 18535 E Smoky Hill Rd, Aurora, CO 80015, USA
reviews: Used to be good. Now missing items and wrong burger orders. Been disappointed enough by this location. Don’t waste your time.

This place used to be good. Now it's not. Everytime I go there, there's some sort of issue, whether it's drive thru being incredibly slow, my order getting messed up, or my shake taking 15 minutes to get carried out, causing it to be melted. I really don't mind driving the extra few miles to go to a Sonic just to avoid this one even if this one is only a mile away from my house
"let's create the tightest drive through ever and then put lamp posts and rocks all along the sides so that people have a hard time getting through. that'll be great..."

My boyfriend and I were so excited to see a sonic, as we don’t have any in the Seattle area. We stopped in and pulled into the stall, as we have always done, and waited. And waited. Finally, someone came on and said they would only help us if we came through the drive thru. Not a problem, but why still have the stalls set up if you aren’t going to service them? They weren’t busy, it was likely just inconvenient for her, as I saw her go out to another car while we were sitting in the stall eating.

Big tasty portions at lightning speed. Drive-in location, so no bathroom or dining area or even register. Good deals: half price iced drinks 2-4pm, chicken, burgers Tuesdays and Thursdays. Great experience if you already like Sonic like me, and my wife's first time which she also enjoyed. Will go again.

name: Corner Store
address: 18565 E Smoky Hill Rd, Centennial, CO 80015, USA
reviews: remodeled inside now and has a few new employees.  Has ruffles and doritos usually along with arizona iced tea and sometimes slim jims.  Planters peanut sections and postachios, milk, and maybe a hot dog rack if you're lucky (don't remember).  It also has some sort of soda/slurpy machine I never use.
This place charged me and didnt even give me gas. And the workers couldn't even speak English and refused to help me.
Always convenient
Great selection.

name: Papa Murphy's Take 'N' Bake Pizza
address: 18525 E Smoky Hill Rd Suite J, Centennial, CO 80015, USA
reviews: Love the Pizzas as always but my wife did an online order for me to pick up and they neglected to give me her salad after I tried to verify I got everything...probably wont be back to this location.
We keep getting pizzas whose tray burns and our house is filled with smoke as a consequence. They need to fix this before we decide not to order from them any longer.

This was my first time trying Papa Murphy's and probably my last. For having to cook the pizza myself it was way over priced. I payed $23 for 2 medium pizzas. One with no toppings and the other with two toppings. I would guess that this cost them maybe $4. That is a huge profit in which they don't put back into their ingredients.  It was just okay.

First when I called in the music in the background was so loud the person couldn’t hear me. I told him he might want to turn down his music. 
The person working the phones was not  competent. I placed an online order at the wrong Smokey Hill location. First he said it would take 5 minutes to find my order, the. When I said it was the wrong location he said he didn’t know how to reverse the charges for on-line orders. Really!!! Train your people better.

Very busy place tonight! The staff were amazingly kind, incredibly professional, and working ever so fast! Papa Murphy's should be very proud of their staff at their Smoky Hill location! The food was so good! Well done!

name: Pioneer Park
address: Aurora, CO 80015, USA
reviews: Fun and family friendly. Soccer field and playground for kids. Picnic tables. Not crowded.
Alot of people come her to smoke and get high here but overall the park is good just by its self it has a soccer field and a littl playground.
I love coming here to hangout with friends. Great place to take kids!
Nice field for soccer practice...
It has a playground and soccer field. No bathroom and walking trail is limited
